thread.title: Gear review: PackTowl Nano Towel
thread.title_full: Gear review: PackTowl Nano Towel - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Jill K. Robinson
title: Gear review: PackTowl Nano Towel
text:
Photo: PackTowl Bring along the PackTowl Nano Towel, and you can give your clothes a rest. Bring along the PackTowl Nano Towel, and you can give your clothes...
On the road, your clothing items become much more than a way to cover your body. They take on the responsibility of napkins and towels — keeping your hands and face dry, and even wipe off your glasses and ski goggles when they become foggy. Bring along the PackTowl Nano Towel, and you can give your clothes a rest. The larger of the two sizes (medium) measures 18 by 33 inches and weighs only 0.9 ounces, so it’s easy to squeeze in a daypack, handlebar bag, or carry-on. Keep it in its mesh bag until you need it, then when you need to clean the towel, just machine wash it and tumble dry (or hang dry using the convenient snap loop).
